title: Positioning
content:
## Normal Flow
The page normal flow is static, elements are position from `left to right` and from `top to bottom`


## Position Types:


* Static
    - Stays in the normal flow
    - Normal Position
* Relative
   - Stays in the normal flow
   - Stays inside Parent
   - Can be moved from its normal position
   - If multiple elements are targeted it moves all them at once, not one by one 
   - Can apply Z-Index
* Sticky
    - Stays in the normal flow
    - Requires TOP/BOTTOM Manipulation (Footer and Header)
    - Combination of Relative and Fixed
---


* Absolute
   - Taken out of the normal flow (Other elements ignore it)
   - Shinks Horizontally
   - If Parent has (Relative) and Child has (Absolute) it will be relative to it
     otherwise it will be relative to the body
   - will position an element in relation to the nearest non-static element
   - Can apply Z-Index
   
   
 * Fixed
   - Taken out of the normal flow (Other elements ignore it)
   - Shinks Horizontally
   - Fixed Relatively to the entire HTML document
   - Can apply Z-Index
